H0.text: Transformed bacteria express a new protein product, which is the most likely effect of transformation on bacteria such as E. coli.

H1.text: Transformed bacteria have multiple chromosomes, the most likely effect of transformation on bacteria such as E. coli.

H2.text: Transformed bacteria reproduce more quickly when they undergo transformation, which is the most likely effect on bacteria such as E. coli.

H3.text: Transformed bacteria become a new species is the statement that describes the most likely effect of transformation on bacteria such as E. coli.

A4.text: the efficiency with which a competent culture can take up exogenous DNA and express its genes is known as transformation efficiency

A5.text: the discovery of artificially induced competence in bacteria allow bacteria such as Escherichia coli to be used as a convenient host for the manipulation of DNA as well as expressing proteins
